meanings.definition: To make small changes to improve the appearance of something.
meanings.sent1: She decided to titivate her room by adding colorful pillows.
meanings.sent2: The gardener would titivate the garden by planting new flowers.
meanings.sent3: He tried to titivate his old car by putting a bow on the antenna.
meanings.sent4: The artist titivated the painting with a touch of gold, making it shine.
meanings.sent5: The chef titivated the dish with a sprinkle of fresh herbs, enhancing its presentation.

meanings.definition: To make oneself look smarter or more attractive by making small changes to one's appearance.
meanings.sent1: She would titivate before going out, adjusting her hair and outfit.
meanings.sent2: He always takes time to titivate before important meetings.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to titivate itself by grooming its fur meticulously.
meanings.sent4: The actor titivated his performance with a charming smile, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent5: The student titivated his presentation with engaging visuals, impressing his classmates.
